conclusion: Determine the distance from the particle's launch position to point P.
Vertical component of velocity when entering magnetic field is v_y = v_0 sqrt(3).
Time taken to travel from launch point to point P is t = mv_0 sqrt(3) / qE.
Horizontal distance traveled by particle is x = m v_0^2 sqrt(3) / qE.
Speed of particle in magnetic field is v = 2v_0.
Radius of circular path in magnetic field is R = m * 2v_0 / qB.
Distance traveled in magnetic field is R sqrt(3).
Magnetic induction strength B = 2mv_0 sqrt(3) / ql.
Vertical distance traveled by particle is y = 3m v_0^2 / 2qE.
